revised_title: Earthquakes and Lineament Infrastructure: Insights from Major Crustal Lineaments
tldr: This article discusses the infrastructure of fault zones within the continental crust and its relation to earthquake ruptures and other aspects of lineament behavior. It focuses on deformation and seismic activity associated with transcurrent fault systems, such as the San Andreas system, and provides insights into the nature of structural controls governing the nucleation and stopping of ruptures along fault zones.
